See more Latest headlines Five miracles of Christ painting sold for £5.7m Barnsley to host art festival's 10th edition The 'It Girl' style wars of Renaissance Italy Sir Stanley Matthews mural unveiled at stadium Turnip Prize winner for 2025 announced at ceremony Features This Indigenous winter scene is not what it seems Satirical artist Wendy Red Star is debunking myths and upending cliches about First Nation and Native people. Now two exhibitions are featuring her work. The centuries-old origins of the witch's hat As Wicked: For Good is released, what are the historic meanings of conical headwear, and how has it evolved – from its ancient origins to the empowered Elphaba? How a Klimt became the most expensive modern artwork Gustav Klimt's Portrait of Elisabeth Lederer, hidden for decades from public view, was sold this week at auction for a record sum. Why is it so valuable? Is this 1768 painting the real birth of modern art? While many argue that "modern art" began in the 1800s, could it actually have started with Joseph Wright of Derby's An Experiment on a Bird in the Air Pump, nearly a century before? Blended wings: The shape of airliners to come? The concept of blended-wing aircraft – where fuselage and wing are all one structure – is not new. But this radical design might soon be a credible concept for airliners. The trailblazing photos of a daredevil WW1 pilot Aviator Alfred Buckham created some of the earliest and most awe-inspiring bird's-eye images – to achieve them, he employed perilous, death-defying acts of ingenuity. Watch Iznik: The Ottoman art that captivated Europe Find out how the ornate ceramics known as Iznik tiles hold the key to a forgotten golden age of Turkish art. Art & Design A look inside Michelangelo's 'secret room' The BBC gets access to Michelangelo's 'secret hiding room' under the Medici Chapel in Florence. Art & Design Striking images capturing the 'dark underbelly of America' Why legendary crime photographer Weegee offers a crucial lens to understand the American psyche. Art & Design How a mythical symbol is inspiring Turkish artists The 'Shahmaran', half-woman and half-snake, is a mythical figure popular in the folklore of Turkey. Art & Design The Lebanese artist championing vegan silk Art critic Alastair Sooke learns about a modern designer's take on Doha's Museum of Islamic Art's collection. Art & Design What do we mean when we talk about 'Islamic art'? Art critic Alastair Sooke travels to Doha to learn about some of the treasures of the Museum of Islamic Art. Art & Design The Doha Hind: The charming 10th-Century garden ornament Art critic Alastair Sooke learns about a decorative 10th-Century treasure at Doha's Museum of Islamic Art. Art & Design Blue Quran: A rare 1,000-year-old masterpiece Art critic Alastair Sooke learns about a masterpiece of the Islamic world at Doha's Museum of Islamic Art. Art & Design Taiwan's last cinema poster painter Partially blind, he vows to continue until he can no longer see. Art Otherworldly scenes of a remote Arctic city Photographer Elena Chernyshova explores what it’s like to live in a city 400km north of the Arctic Circle. Art & Design The renegade artists of a lawless desert town Deep in the Sonoran Desert, an off-grid community are creating art in 'the last free place in America'. Art & Design The beautiful homes made from bamboo Could bamboo be the future of sustainable architecture? Art & Design 60 years of African-American life in pictures Iconic photographer Frank Stewart captured key moments in history: from Fidel Castro the to the stars of jazz. Art & Design The naked portrait covered up for centuries Artemisia Gentileschi: Revealing the true beauty of a censored painting. Art Should we all live in '15-minute cities'? We explore a different model of city life, where everything is on your doorstep. Design What's behind Mona Lisa's indescribable smile? This video has expired. Art The dark history of Comuna 13 Comuna 13 is a thriving hub of graffiti artists, music and culture. But it hasn't always been this way. Art & Design Chromophobia: Who stole the colour from classical art? The way we see ancient Greek and Roman sculpture isn't actually the way it was first created. Art The world's oldest tattoo parlour The Razzouk family are tattoo artists whose history of inking Christian pilgrims stretches back over 700 years. Art Inside the stunning 'new Athens' of Central Europe Jože Plečnik transformed the city of Ljubljana into a 'Slovenian Acropolis'. Design Latest in art and design 2 days ago Students design murals for new hospital building Four students at Arts University Bournemouth designed the murals for the Royal Bournemouth Hospital. 2 days ago 3 days ago Folklore exhibition celebrates winter warmth The display includes embroidery, paintings and collages of real-life and mythical figures from 21 artists. 3 days ago 4 days ago Artists open houses in run-up to  Christmas More than 60 houses stretching across Brighton, Hove and beyond are taking part over three weekends. 4 days ago 4 days ago Docklands museum's art explores Romani identity The museum's display, titled By Appointment Only, showcases three British Romani artists. 4 days ago 4 days ago 'I don't want people to be afraid to grow old' A new exhibition celebrating 60 people over the age of 60 on the Isle of Man is launched. 4 days ago 5 days ago Data meets art: London's voices turned into code for large-scale artwork A new six-storey artwork in Park Royal turns community sounds and stories into striking patterns. 5 days ago 6 days ago Museums at 'critical crossroads' as £2m needed 'Our museums are at a critical crossroads,' say museum trust bosses. 6 days ago 6 days ago Ross Muir on his new Van Gogh painting collaboration Peter Howson and Ross Muir met while walking their dogs in Glasgow's west end. 6 days ago 6 days ago Chris Packham on Turner's 'potential neurodiversity' The conservationist assesses the artist's hyper-focus, evident in his painting. 6 days ago ...
